newsitem.title: NIGERIA: At least 25 killed in Nigerian clash, agency says.
newsitem.headline: At least 25 killed in Nigerian clash, agency says.

text.p: At least 25 people including two policemen were killed in a clash in a Nigerian town where police fired on unemployed youths who attacked and burned down a police station, the national news agency reported on Thursday.
The youths in the midwestern town of Auchi on Wednesday attacked the police whom they blamed for the death of a prominent man in the town, the News Agency of Nigeria said.
They chased the policemen to the town's police station and burned it out. The police fired on the youth after running out of teargas, the agency said.
At least 25 people, including two policemen, were killed and several were wounded in the clashes, it said. Ten vehicles were set ablaze and police firearms and 15 motorcycles were stolen.
More than 50 people were arrested and calm was restored after police reinforcements arrived in Auchi, the agency added.
